verses.roman:
sanakādi bhāgavata śune yāṅra mukhe
bhagavānera guṇa kahe, bhāse prema-sukhe

synonyms: sanaka-ādi—the great sages headed by Sanaka, Sananda, etc.; bhāgavata—Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam; śune—hear; yāṅra mukhe—from whose mouth; bhagavānera—of the Personality of Godhead; guṇa—attributes; kahe—say; bhāse—float; prema-sukhe—in the transcendental bliss of love of Godhead.
translation: The four Kumāras hear Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam from His lips, and they in turn repeat it in the transcendental bliss of love of Godhead.
